content: > a free version of this pattern will be available on my website 1 > this pattern consists of a total of 30 > hexagons i am unable to offer two > versions of this pattern in ravelry > but if you are interested in > purchasing 20 hexagons for $19 99 you > can find the details on my > website 2 welcome to the tunisian blanket cal of 2024 this marks the fifth year of our blanket cal and i m thrilled to share this year s project with you for the 2024 cal we ll be making 30 hexagons each featuring a unique pattern the cal will run from january 2nd to right before thanksgiving see the full schedule below throughout the cal i ll be releasing patterns for all 30 hexagons along with instructions for joining them and adding a border to the blanket i m thrilled with how my blanket turned out and i can t wait to see yours i hope you re as excited about this cal as i am let s make some beautiful blankets together **release schedule** january 2nd - general information and practice hexagon 3 january 9th - hexagon #1 4 january 23rd - hexagon #2 5 february 06th - hexagon #3 6 february 20th - hexagon #4 7 march 05th - extension pack hexagon #1 8 march 12th - hexagon #5 9 march 19th - extension pack hexagon #2 10 march 26th - hexagon #6 11 april 2nd - extension pack hexagon #3 12 april 9th - hexagon #7 13 april 16th - extension pack hexagon #4 14 april 23rd - hexagon #8 15 april 30th - extension pack hexagon #5 16 may 7th - hexagon #9 17 may 14th - extension pack hexagon #6 18 may 21st - joining instructions 19 may 28th - hexagon #10 20 june 4th - extension pack hexagon #7 21 june 11th - hexagon #11 22 june 18th - extension pack hexagon #8 23 june 25th - hexagon #12 24 july 9th - extension pack hexagon #9 25 july 16th - hexagon #13 26 august 6th - extension pack hexagon #10 27 august 20th - hexagon #14 28 september 3rd - hexagon #15 29 september 17th - hexagon #16 30 october 1st - hexagon #17 31 october 15th - hexagon #18 32 october 29th - hexagon #19 33 november 12th - hexagon #20 34 november 26th - border instructions 35 **what to expect in this pattern** 1 general instructions for the cal including supplies needed and stitch tutorials 2 written instructions for each hexagon 3 a chart for each hexagon 4 written instructions for the border 5 support videos **technique and difficulty** intermediate - you should be comfortable working in the round with a double-ended hook if you re new to tunisian-in-the-round consider taking the course a beginner s guide to tunisian-in-the-round 36 before starting this cal **size** the size of the hexagons will depend on the yarn you picked the measurements here
